data.title: Decent port in a storm
data.text: Being exhausted from driving through snarled traffic over the George Washington Bridge, across the Cross Bronx Expressway and up the New York State Thruway we pulled in here to try to get a room.  We got the last one.  The staff were very nice and accommodating.  The room was spacious -- essentially a one bedroom apartment.  The decorations are a bit dated.  Parking was only $5 per night.  The A/C did not work very well, though.  There was copious hot water for the morning shower.  The included breakfast comprised both a hot buffet and cold selections.  No bacon, though!

data.title: typical ri
data.text: great rooms as far as space and comfort in bedding. great staff very friendly and polite. just some issues with air condition unit being very loud and tv was not working correctly a few stations did not come in that were suppose to. the breakfast was great as always and the location was perfect.

data.title: Great value and easy access to New York City
data.text: We drove from New Brunswick in Canada to this hotel. The hotel meant we were close enough to Manhattan without having to drive into it. It was excellent value, provided car parking for just $10 per day and was 3 minutes walk from the train station into Manhattan. The staff were very friendly, the rooms were a great size and clean, and all the facilities were on hand that you could want. Even down to the complimentary freshly baked cookies on the reception counter.

data.title: Smelly and tired
data.text: I had to spend a night at this hotel in October for business.  One things I can say is that the staff is great.  Had no issues with them.  However, the area didn't feel safe.  There was an oder coming from the old carpet that just smelled gross.  The room looked like it hadn't been updated in a long time.  The bed was musty and the room didn't feel comfortable.  I will never stay there again.

data.title: Great stay outside NYC
data.text: We were looking for a low cost way to visit NYC. The plan was to book an inexpensive room near commuter train station. This hotel was perfect. It is right off rt 95 and has inexpensive garage parking. Train is around the corner, I think it is $15 round trip off peak and 35minutes to grand central station. Very convenient. Trains run very frequently (20 mins?).   Will do this again!  Room was clean and newer.

data.title: Very nice Residence Inn.
data.text:
Very convenient to the train station 3 blocks away and right next to many restaurants. The hotel was too cold and the fitness room was mediocre. But the staff was friendly and the room was excellent. Towels not great and pillows too soft. Fan also a bit loud. Room and bathroom are clean and modern. They do allow dogs so keep that in mind.
Stay here for: Location.

data.title: Convenience Epitomized: Made for a Hassle Free Wedding Weekend
data.text: My wife and I used this hotel for our wedding hotel block. The rooms are spacious and there are lots of nearby eateries and entertainment options for multi-day stays. The front desk staff were very attentive, the breakfast buffet better than average, and parking was ample. This hotel made our wedding weekend experience as stress free as possible.

data.title: Good deal for budget travelers to New York
data.text:
My suite was clean & perfectly adequate. The upholstered furniture & bed looked and felt new & fresh, but the dressers & coffee table had clearly seen plenty of use. And there were a few small scuffs in the paint here and there in the suite. Maybe the hotel refreshes itself in stages. 

Downtown New Rochelle is in the process of redevelopment, and this hotel is clearly part of the project. Location is really convenient -- close to the Thruway & train stations. 

For budget travelers who have to visit suburban New York, keep this one in mind. I'll probably stay there again the next time.

data.title: Convenient for Area Activity
data.text: Located near Iona college, relatively easy parking in underground garage, kind staff, typical residence inn combo room with adequate material for meals, included breakfast was served in what seemed like a mad house ... inadequate staff to handle all the folks.

data.title: Simply...Convenient
data.text: All in all convenient! Friendly staff, moderate breakfast, easy access to the supermarket Stop and Shop, movies Regal Theatres, Applebee's, and the tasty Buffalo Wild Wings, 10-minute walk to the train station (35 minutes to Grand Central via train if you wish to go to the city). Spacious rooms with comfy desks...

data.title: Clothing stolen from room
data.text:
We were there for a week. The very next day after checking in, a pair of new Gap athletic shorts were stolen from or room by housekeeping. I say this boldy because of the following: 

1- They were the only pair I brought on the trip, intended to only sleep in them at night. 
2- Before we left that day, I left them hung over the arm of the couch along with some flipflops on the floor beside them. When we returned to the room that evening, flipflops were still there, shorts were gone. 
3- Before calling the front desk, we flipped the room upside down looking for them. went through every drawer in the room, looked under all the furniture, bed, couch pillows, etc. 

When I called the front desk that evening, I said I was giving them them the benefit of the doubt and hoping that housekeeping may have swept them up with towels and bedding. She said she would check with the housekeeping manager and get back to me. She called about 10 minutes later saying that no one was available to assist me until the next morning, to call at 9am. I called 9am sharp, spoke with someone again at the desk who said she would look into what happened and get back to me. I told her that it the shorts weren't even expensive, its' just that it made no sense to take them like that. She agreed and said that's totally not acceptable and that she would talk to whoever she needs to so that this issue will be resolved for us. 

I never heard back from anyone. My wife and I decided that because we would be doing some shopping that week and bring some new things to the room and combining that with not trusting anyone else at that point, we opted to not have anyone in our room until we checked out the next week. 

I also figured that if we tipped at least $10 per day for housekeeping to come in and we would be there 7 days, the loss to that person would be worth more than the shorts that person stole, so in the end, they're the ones that lost... 

In the end though, we're the ones that really lost- because we paid full cost of a stay at the Marriott, got less than what they would've provided for services and someone got to keep themselves a nice new pair of Gap athletic shorts. 

New Rochelle Marriott, save yourselves the trouble of apologizing for the incident, don't offer me any discounts on my next stay, because I'd be an idiot to come back again and risk losing anything else. Just explain the logic to your housekeeping at your next meeting that it would be insanely stupid to steal ANYTHING from your guests because they pack a minimal amount of things, making things very easy to track when missing. 

The only reason why your staff wouldn't give a crap when you tell them this is because they know you do nothing in terms of holding anyone accountable and do nothing to compensate the guest while they are staying there or least at checkout, which would make stealing acceptable to your staff.

data.title: Right down by some entertainment
data.text: We stayed here while visiting family in the area. The rooms were clean and it was quiet. Since we stayed on an upper floor the view of New Rochelle was good. The hotel is attached to a public parking garage but there were plenty of spaced reserved for hotel guests. Some local local bars, theaters and restaurants were nearby and within walking distance.

data.title: Consistent quality & great location
data.text: Consistent quality property as expected from this Marriott extended-stay brand, though I stay for just one night many times.  Excellent location with connected parking and walking distance to multiple restaurants.  Great service from the staff.

owner_response.author: emejias, Manager at Residence Inn New Rochelle, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi jkuczka,

Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us here in New Rochelle!

Our staff prides itself in giving great service so that our guests may return. Clearly they have made that impact on you to come back once and again. I am glad you are always able to take advantage of the surrounding area as we have plenty of entertainment and great food options near by. 

See you soon again!

Emilio Mejias
Director of Rooms
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Residence INN NEW ROCHELLE
data.text:
It was a great place to visit, the front desk staff were very friendly, we had a problem with our housekeeper, she never put clean towels in our room , nor did she clean the room 
other than that it was right across the street from applebee's  buffalo wild wings , and an arcade, it was within walking distance of subway and the train station

data.title: A most convenient hotel.....
data.text:
This was the most convenient hotel for where I needed to go (Iona) But it was convenient in other ways too, there are plenty of restaurants close by, both chains and local restaurants. It was a short walk to the train station and a 32 minute, $15.50 roundtrip train ride into Manhattan (which I did)

The hotel staff were pleasant, my room was clean and large (I was upgraded....thank you very much) and the breakfast was good, but typical for a Residence Inn. The $10 self parking is in a structure next to the hotel in a reserved area adjacent to New Roc. As a Marriott member, wifi was free and there will be cookies and coffee waiting for you at check-in.

Hotel is somewhat pricey for what you're getting, but you're paying for the location and convenience and there's not much competition

The surrounding area was a bit sketchy at night,

data.title: Just ok
data.text:
Pros.  The room was nice. kitchen, living room and bedroom.  People were friendly. Breakfast was good.  Price was good for a small apartment.  
Cons.  Only 2 elevators and one has been broken for months.  Cleaning crew would forget to put clean towels so we had to ask twice in 7 days.

data.title: Was fine but not as nice as many....
data.text:
We stay at Marriott properties almost every time we travel and this time was no exception.  The accommodations were adequate although the bathroom door hit the toilet when you closed the door.   The room was clean but the towels smelled like cigarette smoke.  We had to pay $10/day for parking and when we came back on Friday night, we had difficulty even finding a spot because the hotel shares parking and it's basically next to an entertainment area including a large movie theater.  There were lots of people milling around outside and police walking around as well.

The breakfast area was up on the 10th floor.  We stuck to breakfast basics, bagels and eggs.  The food was ok....nothing special but the dining area was clean.   What we noticed most was that the staff was particularly noisy up there.  Also, when we went to print our boarding passes, there was no staff even around to ask for help.  Called the front desk and was told that the printer was out of ink and that we'd have to go back to the lobby to get assistance.  After about 10 minutes, the front desk staff was able to print our passes and we were on our way.  Overall, compared to other Marriott's, it was just ok.

owner_response.author: emejias, Manager at Residence Inn New Rochelle, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi FloridaDawn,

Thank you for taking the time out to review us on Trip Advisor. 

On behalf of the Residence Inn Team I would like to apologize for the lack of quality service you received during your stay with us. We strive to ensure that every guest leaves our hotel extremely satisfied, however we fell short of that this time around. 

Although we do share parking with the adjacent complex, Residence Inn has dedicated parking for our guests which may not be used by other patrons who are going to the entertainment area. 

I hope you will give us another opportunity to ensure the highest of service here in New Rochellle.

Enjoy Your Summer!
Emilio M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Spacious and Clean Accommodations in New Rochelle
data.text:
I spent three nights at the Residence Inn New Rochelle in conjunction with a conference being held at Iona College.The campus is a little more than a mile away. The spacious room was clean, but a bit worn in spots. It included a small well maintained kitchen. The bathroom area was divided—shower and toilet in a separate room with the sink being adjacent to the sleeping area. The towels were relatively new and soft. 

If there's a guest staying next to your room, be aware that the walls aren't very thick. I could hear the TV, voices, and an alarm go off, but didn't hear any street traffic except for emergency vehicles (9th Floor). The noise was definitely a problem since the adjacent TV stayed on past midnight and the alarm went off at 5:15 am.

My stay included a breakfast that had a wide array of buffet options. It will satisfy most diets.

As mentioned by others, there are many restaurants within walking distance as well as a movie theater. The shoreline and Hudson Park is about a mile away as well. To maintain safety, a room key is required to use the elevator.

The front desk staff was extremely cordial and helpful. Kelly, one of the managers, provided useful information that helped to make my stay more enjoyable.

owner_response.author: emejias, Manager at Residence Inn New Rochelle, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi SandyB56!

Thank you so much for taking the time out to review us using Trip Advisor!

It is great to hear that your room was clean and comfortable. Our Residence Inn team always tries hard to ensure that your stay is extremely satisfying and are sorry that you were not able to get a quiet night's rest. I can imagine it was hard to get some shut eye with the television loud and the alarm going off shortly after. In the future, you may try calling our Front Office staff and they may be able to communicate with the adjacent guest to lower the volume on their television. 

Kelly is a star player on our team and she will appreciate your comments on how she helped make your stay better!

See you soon!

Emilio M
Director of Rooms
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable and convenirny
data.text: We stayed one night in this clean and conveniently located high-rise hotel in downtown New Rochelle. Our son was graduating from Fordham University, and this hotel was perfectly serviceable and about 30 minutes from campus. The bathroom area was a little tight for a 1BR suite (w/3 people) but the room was fine and the staff was friendly.

owner_response.author: emejias, Manager at Residence Inn New Rochelle, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi mmmurphy179,

First off, Congratulations to your son and family on the graduation! It is so good to hear that you enjoyed your stay here in New Rochelle and will let the staff know what a good job they did. See you soon!

Regards, 
Emilio Mejias
Director of Rooms
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Marriott Residence Inn, Great Staff!
data.text:
I stayed in New Rochelle at the Residence Inn for a week in May. This was a business trip, so I did not get to enjoy many of the amenities. Location of the hotel is nice. There are many restaurants within walking distance. There is also a large movie theater complex next door and a Stop & Shop. There is an outdoor pool that is not open yet.

As a Platinum member, high-speed internet is free and parking in the Parking garage is free as well. These are the best 2 Platinum perks I have received from a Marriott property!

On Monday, Tuesday and Wedneday evenings, there is food available on the 10th floor. There is also free breakfast in the morning, but I did not get a chance to check it out. I did like that coffee and tea are available in the lobby 24/7. Many Marriott's have eliminated this perk,

My room was nice and clean. It was spacious and housekeeping did a nice job refreshing my room every day.

I did have an issue with the toilet not flushing. I notified the front desk and the issue was taken care of immediately.

There was a parkingissue that I  encountered on the last night of my stay. The City of New Rochelle is replacing the sidewalk in front of the entrance to the hotel and access to the hotel from the parking garage  was completely closed off. Not being familiar with the area, I had no idea how to enter the property. At 1am, it was scary, being in a parking garage not knowing how to get into the hotel.

Fortunately, there was another lady checking in and a Marriott employee was assisting her. He walked us to a different elevator and directed us a different, unmarked elevator to the hotel. Had I been alone, I would have been extremely upset as this was an extreme safety issue.

In the morning, at check-out, I informed the front desk of the entrance issue and the General Manager personally escorted me to my car. I did suggest to him to put up a sign for other guests so they would not be locked out. He was very kind, as was the gentleman, Dravie, who helped the night before.

This property will go above and beyond to correct any issues! Staff is amazing! I am returning next week and am looking forward to staying there again.

owner_response.author: emejias, Manager at Residence Inn New Rochelle, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi kdtjake, 

I am so glad to hear that our staff was able to be of great service to you even though there were a couple of blips during your stay. We pride ourselves in making sure each guest leaves New Rochelle in great spirits, and succeeded with yours. I hope you come back soon on a longer stay to enjoy more of what we have to offer!!

Regards, 
Emilio Mejias
Director of Rooms
owner_response.title: Owner Response
